title: Latest ET Manufacturing | Latest Manufacturing News : ETManufacturing.in

items.title: Mazagon Dock Shipbuilders, Swan Defence ink pact to build landing platform docks for Indian Navy
Impact of current trade policies on the welding industry in the long run
ABB India expands drive production line
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- ABB India expanded its Peenya, Bengaluru plant with a new production line for variable speed drive (VSD) modules, boosting local capacity by ~**25%** and enabling energy-efficient applications. 
- The expansion supports *Atmanirbhar Bharat* and *Make in India*, cuts lead times by up to **40%**, and leverages Industry 4.0 through automation and digital monitoring. 
- With two decades of India drives production and 50 years of global innovation, ABB drives help optimise energy use across transport, metals and pharma.

items.title: Big-ticket energy push: BPCL signs MoUs with Indian Oil, Numaligarh Refinery, and Fertilisers & Chemicals Travancore
India's electronics sector poised for big leap to large-scale production
Automakers pool with EV makers to avoid EU emissions fines
items.summary:
- *EU emissions fines* could reach up to **€15 billion**, prompting automakers to form alliances to buy *credits* from EV makers to stay compliant. 
- Pools include Mazda-Changan Mazda, Nissan-BYD, KG Mobility-Xpeng, and a Tesla-led group with Stellantis, Toyota, Ford, Leapmotor, Mazda and Subaru, plus Honda-Suzuki and a Mercedes-Volvo-Polestar-Smart venture. 
- EVs were about **12%** of European light-vehicle sales last year and are expected to rise to **40%** by the decade’s end, driving a credit-based compliance path.

items.title: Pharma & healthcare deal surge 166% in Q3 2025
items.summary:
- In Q3 2025, pharma and healthcare deals rose to 72 transactions worth about $3.5B, up 166% QoQ, with pharma/biotech making ~26% of deals. 
- Torrent Pharma led with a $1.4B acquisition of JB Chemicals; hospitals saw 19 deals worth $264M, driven by single-specialty formats and regional consolidation. 
- Outbound cross-border deals rose (Natco’s $235M Adcock Ingram stake) while PE remained subdued, with notable fundraises like Aragen Life Sciences’ $35M.

items.title: HAL-UAC sign to produce SJ-100 in India
items.summary:
- HAL and **UAC** sign an MoU to produce the **SJ-100** in India, boosting *self-reliance* in civil aviation.
- HAL will hold rights to manufacture the **SJ-100** for domestic customers, aligning with India's *UDAN* regional connectivity goals.
- The agreement is expected to spur India's aviation ecosystem, support thousands of jobs, and meet growing regional jet demand over the next decade.

items.title: L&T Heavy Engineering bags significant orders across India and overseas
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- In India, L&T Heavy Engineering won a 2RK65 Heat Exchanger Package (four units) for a 3 MMTPA PTA project at Dahej, Gujarat.
- Overseas, it secured US orders for NGL fractionator vessels and a blue ammonia cartridge in Louisiana, plus Mexico ammonia/urea plants, Brazil heat exchangers, and Saudi Arabia refinery-petrochemical revamp work.
- The company says these wins highlight its reliability and ability to deliver high‑performance engineering solutions globally, including equipment for international and domestic nuclear projects.

items.title: Concord Control Systems’ associate gets RDSO nod for Kavach 4.0 trials
JSW Steel to boost raw material security via ore and coal
items.summary:
- *JSW Steel* is ramping up its in-house raw material security via a diversified mix of domestic iron ore and *coking coal* assets and offshore acquisitions, including boosting its stake in Australia's *Illawarra* coking coal asset from 20% to 30%. 
- It is pursuing the *Minas de Revuboe* project in *Mozambique* to secure premium low-volatile *coking coal*, with an expected close in the current financial year. 
- Domestically, capacity expansion spans new iron ore mines in *Karnataka* (Q1 FY27 ~4 MT/year) and *Goa* (Cudnem by FY26 Q3; Surla and Codli by FY27, ~3.7 MT), plus two exploration blocks in *Maharashtra* and *Andhra Pradesh* slated to come online later, and *Jharkhand* coking coal assets with linkages from Coal India.

items.title: Dürr completes turnkey paint shop for Škoda plant in Vietnam
items.author: ETAuto Desk
items.summary:
- **Dürr** completed a turnkey paint shop at the Thanh Cong Viet Hung plant in Quang Ninh, enabling **Škoda** production in Vietnam.
- The facility features **Dürr’s RoDip E system** with programmable trolleys that allow independent vehicle body control, boosting coating quality and energy efficiency.
- Located near Haiphong Port, the plant supports CKD kit imports from Pune, with first phase at **13 jobs/hour**, scalable to **20 jobs/hour**, and capacity up to **120,000 vehicles/year**.

items.title: MSMEs resilient despite US tariffs: SIDBI Survey
items.summary:
- *Export performance* dipped, with only *43%* of MSMEs reporting positive growth, but *optimism* remains high for the next year.
- *SIDBI survey* indicates manufacturing and services may sustain positive momentum despite global headwinds.
- *Most MSMEs* reported stable profit margins, with some improvements and ongoing *profitability optimism*.

items.title: Foxconn to invest up to NT$42B in AI compute cluster
items.author: Wen-Yee Lee (Reuters)
items.summary:
- *Foxconn*'s board approved up to NT$42 billion to procure an *AI compute cluster* and a *supercomputing centre*, expanding its *cloud compute* capabilities.
- The plan runs from December 2025 to December 2026 and will be funded entirely by Foxconn's own funds, with deployment expected in *Taiwan*.
- The move reinforces Foxconn's push into *AI* and cloud infrastructure, building on earlier efforts like an *Nvidia* AI centre in Taiwan and the Stargate data-center project.

items.title: Maharashtra signs ₹56k crore maritime deals
items.summary: - Maharashtra signed **15 MoUs** totaling **₹56,000 crore** in maritime projects during India Maritime Week, signalling a major push. - The deals include port expansions, shipyards, technology, a **water taxi** from Navi Mumbai airport, a Mumbai marina, and an industrial zone around **Dighi port** with partners like **Adani** and **JSW**. - CM Devendra Fadnavis says these moves will integrate Maharashtra with **global supply chains** and push it toward becoming a maritime **superpower**.

items.title: MeitY clears ₹5,500 crore electronic parts manufacturing investment
Elon Musk’s Starlink Satellite leases office space in Mumbai’s Chandivali
Robot dogs and AI drone swarms: How China could use DeepSeek for an era of war
Explained: Why critical minerals will decide India’s economic and strategic future
Sona Comstar puts JV with Jinnaite on hold
items.author: ETAuto Desk
items.summary:
- The board has put the proposed **joint venture** with China’s *Jinnaite Machinery* in *abeyance*, while leaving room for future collaboration on select *foundry products*. 
- The binding term sheet signed in July 2025 has been **rescinded**, signaling a pause in deal activity. 
- Sona Comstar appointed Pratik Sachan as Head – **Strategy & M&A**, underscoring a focus on strategic growth initiatives and investor relations.

items.title: US Department of Energy forms $1 billion supercomputer and AI partnership with AMD
FMCG firms see Sept disruption but bullish on growth
items.author: Press Trust of India
items.summary:
- FMCG firms faced September-quarter hits from *GST reforms* and *heavy rains*, but remain optimistic about recovery.
- Executives from Unilever, Reckitt, Heineken, Coca-Cola and PepsiCo highlighted *India's growth potential* amid improving *macro-economic conditions*.
- Disruptions easing and channel improvements are expected to support *growth* in coming quarters.

items.title: India approves $626m for electronics components projects
items.author: Reuters
items.summary:
- The government approved **seven projects** worth over **55 billion rupees** ($626 million) to boost domestic electronics components manufacturing, including PCBs, camera modules and laminates.
- Projects by **Kaynes Circuits India**, SRF, Syrma and **Ascent Circuits** will be in *Tamil Nadu*, *Andhra Pradesh* and *Madhya Pradesh*, creating over **5,100 jobs**.
- The move aims to cut import dependence and strengthen supply chains for defence, telecom, EVs and renewables, backed by **PLI schemes** and the *Semiconductor Mission*.

items.title: Effective use of Made-in-India equipment during Op Sindoor bolstered India's reputation: Rajnath Singh
Odisha showcases ₹70,000-crore maritime investment push at India Maritime Week 2025
HYDGEN raises $5M to scale modular green H2 electrolysers
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- HYDGEN raised a mix of equity and debt to scale its proprietary *Anion Exchange Membrane (AEM)* electrolyser technology.
- The funds will upgrade the Mangalore facility, expand production, and push into **Japan, Europe, and the Middle East** to meet growing demand for *green hydrogen*.
- Its modular electrolysers span 1 kW–100 kW, enabling *on-site, ultra-pure hydrogen* production and paving the way for a 250 kW single-stack system for large industrial users.

items.title: Jubilant Ingrevia Q2 net profit rises 18% to ₹70 crore
items.summary: - **Jubilant Ingrevia**'s Q2 net profit rose 18% YoY to ₹70 crore, as total revenue climbed to **₹1,121 crore**.\n- The growth was led by the **speciality chemicals** segment, which accounted for 43% of revenue and grew 12% YoY, with EBITDA up 8%.\n- For the first half (April-September FY26), revenue totaled **₹2,159 crore**, up 4% YoY, and net profit rose 34% to **₹145 crore**.

items.title: Candytoy to invest ₹100 crore for expansion in Indore
items.summary:
- Candytoy will invest **₹100 crore** to build three new facilities in *Indore*, expanding over 500,000 sq ft to boost capacity.
- Expansion will create about 1,000 jobs and add products like *balloon toys*, *popping candy*, and *cotton candy*, plus export‑oriented toys tied to global festivals.
- This aims to position *Indore* as a global Candytoy hub and complements the new showroom, expanding export markets to Europe, the US, Africa, and the Gulf.

items.title: Rashmi Group to set up steel, power plant in West Bengal
items.summary:
- Rashmi Group will set up a *2.8 MTPA integrated steel plant* and a *400 MW captive power plant* at Purulia, West Bengal.
- The West Bengal government has allotted 938 acres of land for the projects, with proposed investments of *Rs 1,0000 crore* and the creation of *18,000 jobs*.
- The plan spans across *iron and steel*, *power*, *ferro alloys* and *mining*, aligning with the state's industrial development goals.

items.title: Indian automakers set for double-digit profit growth in Q2 after five-quarter lull: Report
India’s solar sector attracts $17.3 billion in corporate funding in Jan-Sept 2025: Report
MOL and SCI to expand green tugboat ops in India
items.author: ET Infra Desk
items.summary:
- MOL and SCI sign an MoU to expand tugboat services in India, aligning with the *Green Tug Transition Programme* to cut port emissions.
- MOL brings safe‑operations know‑how and alternative fuel tech to work with SCI’s network amid rising port activity and cargo growth.
- The initiative targets a 2040 shift to **green tugs**, signaling lasting gains in air quality and port efficiency.

items.title: Nithia Capital buys Topworth Urja for ₹300 cr to grow steel
items.author: ET Infra Desk
items.summary:
- **Nithia Capital** completes the acquisition of **Topworth Urja and Metals** for **₹300 crore** to expand steel capacity, marking its third steel-asset buy in India. 
- Urja near Nagpur operates a 0.2 mtpa long-products plant with DRI, steelmaking, rolling and 35 MW captive power; **Nithia** plans to rehabilitate and expand to 0.5 mtpa and maximize power generation. 
- The group targets exceeding **6 mtpa** steel capacity in India as it leverages the deal to bolster its portfolio, with leaders citing the **IBC** framework's role.

items.title: Kranti signs MoU with Universal Autofoundry
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- Kranti Industries and **Universal Autofoundry** signed a **MoU** to establish a long-term **machining alliance** in **Rajasthan**, integrating foundry and machining into a unified manufacturing setup serving the automotive and engineering sectors. 
- Under the agreement, **Universal Autofoundry** will lease its machining premises at **Sargoth** in **Sikar district** and consolidate its machine shops at **Unit 3**, with **Kranti** operating exclusively for casting components manufactured by Universal. 
- The collaboration marks Kranti’s entry into **northern India**, expanding beyond its western base to improve **logistics**, **quality**, and **delivery timelines** through shared infrastructure.

items.title: Harman invests ₹345 crore to expand Pune automotive manufacturing plant
Trump strikes deals on trade, critical minerals in Southeast Asia
Exosens increases capacity expansion plans amid strong revenue growth
items.summary:
- Exosens will increase *global capacity* by 40% by 2027 with an additional **€17 million** investment in *Europe*, up from the 25% expansion previously announced. 
- Revenue rose **€327.8 million** in the first nine months of 2025, up 23.2%, driven by **Amplification** (+21%) and **Detection & Imaging** (+26%). 
- CEO Jerome Cerisier said the company will implement an **additional staggered capacity expansion** to meet sustained demand and reaffirm full-year guidance.

items.title: Candytoy to invest ₹100 cr for 3 new units
items.author: PTI
items.summary:
- Candytoy plans *₹100 cr* investment to add three facilities in *Indore*, MP.
- Projects 500,000 sq ft and will create roughly *1,000* jobs in the region.
- Director Gaurav Mirchandani says Indore will be a global hub for Candytoy; the firm had a prior *₹110 cr* Series A.

items.title: Shree Cement commissions 20-MW solar plant in Uttar Pradesh
items.author: ETEnergyWorld Desk
items.summary:
- Shree Cement commissioned a **20 MW solar power plant** in *Chitrakoot district*, *Uttar Pradesh*, with Phase-I commercially operational and Phase-II due by end of Q4 FY26.
- The plant will supply renewable energy to the Etah grinding unit via the *Wheeling and Banking route* and is expected to offset about **22,000 metric tonnes of CO2** annually.
- Once fully online, the company’s installed solar capacity rises to **313.5 MW**, and the project is projected to create **30-40 daily** local jobs for the community.

items.title: Goldman Sachs: India's defense market set to grow
items.summary:
- Goldman Sachs notes an expanding *Total Addressable Market (TAM)* for India's defense sector, with AoNs totalling **₹2.5 trillion** in FY26, up from FY25.
- DAC approvals worth **₹790 billion** across the Navy, Army, and Air Force reinforce government focus and rising defense spending.
- They expect benefits to **trickle down** to the *private sector*, sustaining **earnings momentum** and signaling *long-term* defense-market growth.

items.title: India faces challenges in local rare earth production amidst China's export restrictions
50 MW Kudankulam draw approved for Units 3 and 4
items.summary:
- *CEA* approved a **50 MW** draw from Kudankulam Unit 1 to support start-up and commissioning of *Units 3 and 4*, effective Oct 19, 2025. 
- CSAT energised; SRLDC will schedule the draw, with peak start-up demand seen at **60 MW** by Dec 2025 and **65 MW** by Jan 2026 as Units 3 and 4 progress. 
- Tamil Nadu has sought full allocation of the 2,000 MW from Units 3 and 4; Centre decision is pending.

items.title: Singapore expands land for green energy and data centres
items.author: Reuters
items.summary:
- About 300 hectares on *Jurong Island*'s western side will be set aside for *renewable energy projects* and *low-carbon fuel production*.
- Separately, 20 hectares will become Singapore's largest *data centre park*, designed to support up to *700 MW* of power, tapping into the island's energy ecosystem.
- The plan aims to make *Jurong Island* a global test-bed for new energies and *low-carbon technologies*, including *solar*, *sustainable aviation fuel*, *low-carbon ammonia*, and *hydrogen-ready* plants.

items.title: Telangana eyes 19,000 MW demand as Yadadri nears
items.summary:
- *Yadadri thermal power station* is set to come online in phases, lifting Telangana's capacity to meet projected 19,000 MW demand. 
- Authorities have ordered grid upgrades, including new sub-stations, transformers, and **SCADA-like** monitoring to ensure reliable supply through summer and rabi. 
- Coal supply will be ramped up by *Singareni Collieries Company Ltd* from 1.80 lakh to 2.20 lakh tonnes per day by November to back the generation push.

items.title: Indian automakers gear up for SA manufacturing expansion
items.author: ETAuto Desk
items.summary:
- South Africa is inviting Indian and Chinese automakers to upgrade lines to **CKD** and expand local production for stronger exports.
- **Mahindra & Mahindra** plans to upgrade from SKD to CKD and explore **EV** assembly in Durban, backed by policy support for clean mobility.
- Tata Motors is re-entering via a Motus partnership, while talks with Toyota and Ford aim to sustain production amid tariff risks and rising competition.

items.title: Low-end smartphones may get costlier as chipmakers shift focus to AI servers
iPhone boom lifts India's electronics exports
items.author: Kiran Rathee, ET Bureau
items.summary:
- *Electronics exports* could overtake *petroleum* to become India's second-largest category, aided by curbs on *Russian oil*.
- *In H1 FY26,* *electronics* rose 42% to $22.2B, with about half from *Apple iPhones*, making it the fastest-growing sector.
- Over three years, *exports* jumped 63% while *petroleum* declined and *engineering* led the top categories.

items.title: Empowering women engineers to thrive in India’s manufacturing sector
Significant percentage of manufacturing leadership appointments were external hires: Report
IMF: India's growth driven by domestic demand
items.summary:
- IMF's World Economic Outlook projects India to remain the fastest-growing major economy, with about 6.6% growth in 2026.
- Growth is anchored by three drivers: rising *domestic consumption*, a revival in *manufacturing*, and strong performance in *services*.
- Analysts urge translating this momentum into inclusive gains—more jobs, poverty reduction, and investments in infrastructure, education, and health.
